result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin H Olson

defendant.name: Olson, Justin H

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CM219, 22CF16, 22CF103, 22CF349 called at 1:37pm
Defendant Justin H Olson in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Justin H Olson.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 
Atty Huebner indicates that a comprehensive offer has been extended by the State this morning; requests an adjournment. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occurs in Case 22CF349: 
Mr. Olson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 1:45pm  

NEXT:  Status Conference on 11/17/22 at 9:00am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Zoom ok

[ml] Cases 21CM219, 22CF16, 22CF102, and 22CF349 called at 10:51AM
Defendant Justin H Olson appeared by video.  Attorney Karl E Huebner appeared by video. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Att Huebner requests that another Status Conference be scheduled, stating that the Defendant has been screened, and approved, for treatment court. ADA Parson advises that she will complete the State's treatment court offer next week and disburse it to the Defense.

The Court sets this matter over for an anticipated Waiver of Preliminary and a Plea and Sentencing Hearing, with an expected treatment court disposition.

recess 10:54AM

NEXT: 
(1) As to file 22CF349: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing 
(2) As to all other files: Plea and Sentencing on 10/25 at 1:30PM

[MK] cases  #21CM219, #22CF16, #22CF102 called at 10:39am 
Defendant Justin H Olson in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In Cases #22CF16 and #22CF102 Prelim-Waivers and Arraignments are held: 
---Mr. Olson waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trials.
--service of Informations is admitted, reading is waived.
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered in both cases 
--Attorney Huebner requests the scheduling of a pretrial conference.

Bond Document rec'd from JESO on 2/28/22
Scheduling Order
Status conference on March 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Karl Huebner

Conditions of this Bond include:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescribed controlled substances only as directed by the prescribing physician
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

[ml] Case called at 1:19PM
Defendant Justin H Olson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
The Court finds Probable Cause to exist on the four corner of the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires a $1,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescribed controlled substances only as directed by the prescribing physician
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

Att Nelson advises that the Defendant currently has other cases open that Att Huebner is appointed to, and requests that this case track along for scheduling with those cases.

recess 1:27PM

NEXT: Status Conference on 03/10 at 9:30AM
Def. has existing Branch 3 case
